compctl -g ' .tar.bz2 *.tar.gz *.bz2 *.gz *.jar *.rar *.tar *.tbz2 *.tgz *.zip *.Z' + -g ' (-/)' extractextract() {    if [[ -z "$1" ]] ; then        print -P "usage: \e[1;36mextract\e[1;0m < filename > "        print -P "       Extract the file specified based on the extension"    elif [[ -f $1 ]] ; then        case ${(L)1} in .tar.bz2)  tar -jxvf $1    ;; .tar.gz)   tar -zxvf $1    ;; .bz2)      bunzip2 $1       ;; .gz)       gunzip $1       ;; .jar)      unzip $1       ;; .rar)      unrar x $1       ;; .tar)      tar -xvf $1       ;; .tbz2)     tar -jxvf $1    ;; .tgz)      tar -zxvf $1    ;; .zip)      unzip $1          ;; .Z)        uncompress $1    ;; )          echo "Unable to extract '$1' :: Unknown extension"        esac    else        echo "File ('$1') does not exist!"    fi }

Post._content:
:http://www.deepvps.com/dropbox-backup.html

dropboxdropboxVPSdeepvpscron
1.linuxdropbox

32linux

    wget -O dropbox.tar.gz http://www.dropbox.com/download?plat=lnx.x86

64linux

    wget -O dropbox.tar.gz http://www.dropbox.com/download?plat=lnx.x86_64



    tar xzvf dropbox.tar.gz

host_id

    ~/.dropbox-dist/dropboxd &

idhost_id

    https://www.dropbox.com/cli_link?host_id=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

2.

ln

    cd ~/Dropbox
    ln -s /home/wwwroot/html
    ln -s /home/wwwroot/htdocs
    

vps1Ghtml

    ~/.dropbox-dist/dropboxd &

3.



    killall dropbox



    vi backup.sh



    #!/bin/sh
    start() {
    echo starting dropbox
    /root/.dropbox-dist/dropboxd &
    }
    stop() {
    echo stoping dropbox
    pkill dropbox
    }
    case $1 in
    start)
    start
    ;;
    stop)
    stop
    ;;
    restart)
    stop
    start
    ;;
    esac



    chmod +x backup.sh
    crontab -e

45
10

    0 4 * * * sh /root/backup.sh restart

    0 5 * * * sh /root/backup.sh stop

4.

    vi bakmysql.sh



    #!/bin/bash
    DBName=
    DBUser=
    DBPasswd=
    BackupPath=/root/Dropbox/
    LogFile=/root/db.log
    DBPath=/usr/local/mysql/var/ #
    #BackupMethod=mysqldump
    #BackupMethod=mysqlhotcopy
    #BackupMethod=tar

    NewFile=$BackupPathdb$(date +%y%m%d).tgz
    DumpFile=$BackupPathdb$(date +%y%m%d)
    OldFile=$BackupPathdb$(date +%y%m%d date=5 days ago).tgz #5
    echo - >> $LogFile
    echo $(date +%y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S) >> $LogFile
    echo  >> $LogFile
    #Delete Old File
    if [ -f $OldFile ]
    then
    rm -f $OldFile >> $LogFile 2>&1
    echo [$OldFile]Delete Old File Success! >> $LogFile
    else
    echo [$OldFile]No Old Backup File! >> $LogFile
    fi
    if [ -f $NewFile ]
    then
    echo [$NewFile]The Backup File is exists,Cant Backup! >> $LogFile
    else
    case $BackupMethod in
    mysqldump)
    if [ -z $DBPasswd ]
    then
    mysqldump -u $DBUser opt $DBName > $DumpFile
    else
    mysqldump -u $DBUser -p$DBPasswd opt $DBName > $DumpFile
    fi
    tar czvf $NewFile $DumpFile >> $LogFile 2>&1
    echo [$NewFile]Backup Success! >> $LogFile
    rm -rf $DumpFile
    ;;
    mysqlhotcopy)
    rm -rf $DumpFile
    mkdir $DumpFile
    if [ -z $DBPasswd ]
    then
    mysqlhotcopy -u $DBUser $DBName $DumpFile >> $LogFile 2>&1
    else
    mysqlhotcopy -u $DBUser -p $DBPasswd $DBName $DumpFile >>$LogFile 2>&1
    fi
    tar czvf $NewFile $DumpFile >> $LogFile 2>&1
    echo [$NewFile]Backup Success! >> $LogFile
    rm -rf $DumpFile
    ;;
    *)
    service mysql stop >/dev/null 2>&1
    tar czvf $NewFile $DBPath$DBName >> $LogFile 2>&1
    service mysql start >/dev/null 2>&1
    echo [$NewFile]Backup Success! >> $LogFile
    ;;
    esac
    fi
    echo - >> $LogFile

5.dropbox

    killall dropbox
    rm -rf .dropbox .dropbox-dist Dropbox dropbox.tar.gz dbmakefakelib.py dbreadconfig.py

Post.title: ubuntu  go
Post._content:
# Go

## 

go  package, 

	sudo apt-get install bison ed gawk gcc libc6-dev make python-setuptools python-dev build-essential git mercurial

## Go

 [](http://golang.org/dl/) 

	$ tar -C /usr/local -xzf go$VERSION.$OS-$ARCH.tar.gz

 /usr/local/go 

## 

	#go config
	export GOROOT=/usr/local/go
	export GOARCH=amd64
	export GOOS=linux
	export GOPATH=/srv/go_root
	export GOBIN=$GOROOT/bin
	export GOTOOLS=$GOROOT/pkg/tool/
	export PATH=$PATH:$GOBIN:$GOTOOLS:$GOPATH/bin

 /usr/local/go  go  /srv/go_root 
 .bashrc  source ~/.bashrc 

# Supervisor

 go  crontab  Supervisor 

## 

	#
	sudo apt-get install python-pip python-m2crypto python-gevent supervisor
	pip install shadowsocks superlance

	#
	curl https://bitbucket.org/pypa/setuptools/raw/bootstrap/ez_setup.py | sudo python

	#
	echo_supervisord_conf /etc/supervisor/supervisor.conf

## 

 /etc/supervisor/conf.d/ 

	[program:web_hello]								#
	command=/usr/local/go/bin/go run hello.go		#
	autostart=true									#
	autorestart=true								#
	user=root										#
	redirect_stderr=true							#
	directory=/srv/go_root/src/web_hello/			#
	stderr_logfile=/srv/logroot/web_hello/error.log	#
	stdout_logfile=/srv/logroot/web_hello/debug.log	#

## 



	supervisorctl reload		#
	supervisorctl restart all 	#

## 

 reload  Supervisor 

	apt-get purge supervisor
	reboot
	apt-get install supervisor
	echo_supervisord_conf /etc/supervisor/supervisor.conf

# shadowsocks

## 

	# on server
	go get github.com/shadowsocks/shadowsocks-go/cmd/shadowsocks-server

## 

	{
	    "server":"127.0.0.1",
	    "server_port":8388,
	    "local_port":1080,
	    "password":"barfoo!",
	    "method": "aes-256-cfb",
	    "timeout":600
	}

##  Supervisor

	[program:shadowsocks]
	command=/usr/local/go/bin/shadowsocks-server -c /srv/approot/shadowsocks/config.json
	autostart=true
	autorestart=true
	user=root
	redirect_stderr=true
	stderr_logfile=/srv/logroot/shadowsocks/supervisor.log
	stdout_logfile=/srv/logroot/shadowsocks/supervisor.log

## 

	supervisorctl restart all
	supervisorctl reload
	supervisorctl restart all

# nginx

 nginx 

## 

	$ sudo apt-get install nginx

## 

 /etc/nginx/sites-available  ghost.conf 
 (e.g. sudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/ghost.conf) 

	server {
	    listen 80;
	    server_name example.com;

	    location / {
	        proxy_set_header   X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
	        proxy_set_header   Host      $http_host;
	        proxy_pass         http://127.0.0.1:2368;
	    }
	}

 server_name 

 sites-enabled :

	$ sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/ghost.conf /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/ghost.conf

## 

	$ sudo service nginx restart

end.

Post.title: smarty
Post._content:
smarty  {  } delimiter

 html  smarty 

smarty error : syntax error: unrecognized tag


 2 

1

ldelim, rdelim
ldelim and rdelim are used for displaying the literal delimiter, in our case { or }. The template engine always tries to interpret delimiters, so this is the way around that.
ldelim  rdelim  {  }

2 

 html  javascript smarty 

  {literal}{/literal}

    {literal}
        <script type="text/javascript">
        function sayHello() {alert(Hello World!)}
        </script>
    {/literal}

#Shadowsocks

shadowsocks  ss  ss:// 

## 
IT [ShadowSocks](https://www.shadowsocks.net/) 

 [Shadowsocks ](https://github.com/clowwindy/shadowsocks/wiki/Ports-and-Clients)

## Windows && Linux && OSX
 [cow](https://github.com/cyfdecyf/cow) , golang  HTTP  http,ssh   ss  cow 
  cow  http,ssh,ss  pac 

### 
OS X, Linux (x86, ARM): 

	curl -L git.io/cow | bash

Windows: [](http://dl.chenyufei.info/cow/)

 Go  go get github.com/cyfdecyf/cow 
 ~/.cow/rc (Linux)  rc.txt (Windows)

	#
	#  HTTP 
	#  HTTP  HTTPS 
	#  http://127.0.0.1:7777/pac
	listen = http://127.0.0.1:7777

	# SOCKS5 
	proxy = socks5://127.0.0.1:1080
	# HTTP 
	proxy = http://127.0.0.1:8080
	proxy = http://user:password@127.0.0.1:8080
	# shadowsocks 
	proxy = ss://aes-128-cfb:password@1.2.3.4:8388
	# cow 
	proxy = cow://aes-128-cfb:password@1.2.3.4:8388
	 cow  COW

	listen = cow://aes-128-cfb:password@0.0.0.0:8388
	 COW 

IE internet  ->  ->  -> http://127.0.0.1:7777/pac OK

## 

Shadowsocks  c, go, nodejs, python, erlang [Shadowsocks ](https://github.com/clowwindy/shadowsocks/wiki/Ports-and-Clients)

 python  ss



	apt-get update
	apt-get install python-pip python-m2crypto supervisor
	pip install shadowsocks



	service supervisor start
	supervisorctl reload



	supervisorctl tail -f shadowsocks stderr

 shadowsocks  /etc/shadowsocks.json  shadowsocks

	supervisorctl restart shadowsocks

 Supervisor  /etc/supervisor/*  supervisor 

	supervisorctl update

Shadowsocks 

	ssserver -c /etc/shadowsocks.json -d start
	ssserver -c /etc/shadowsocks.json -d stop

    function checkweek($day)

    {

    $month = date('m', time()); // 

    $year = date('Y', time()); // 

    $firstday = date('w', mktime(0, 0, 0, $month, 1, $year)); //1

    $firstweek = 7 - $firstday; // 1

    $week = ceil(($day - $firstweek) / 7) + 1; return $year.''.$month.''.$day . '' . $week . '';

    }

    $a = checkweek(14); //

    echo $a;

Post.title: laravel
Post._content:
laravel 

## 

### composer

    $ curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php
    $ mv composer.phar /usr/local/bin/composer

 php 

### PEAR

Download PEAR

    curl -O http://pear.php.net/go-pear.phar
    sudo php -d detect_unicode=0 go-pear.phar

Configure and Install PEAR

You should now be at a prompt to configure PEAR.

Type 1 and press return .
Enter:

    /usr/local/pear

Type 4 and press return .

Enter:

    /usr/local/bin

Press return

Verify PEAR

You should be able to type:

    pear version

### json

    apt-get install php5-json

### mcrypt

    sudo rm /etc/php5/mods-available/mcrypt.ini
    sudo apt-get purge php5-mcrypt
    sudo apt-get install mcrypt
    sudo apt-get install php5-mcrypt
    sudo php5enmod mcrypt
    sudo service php5-fpm restart

##  Laravel

 Composer  Laravel 

    composer global require "laravel/installer=~1.1"

 ~/.composer/vendor/bin  PATH , laravel ,  laravel .
,  laravel new  Laravellaravel new blog  blog ,  Laravel  Composer 

## 

    location / {
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?$query_string;
    }



## 

 Laravel git init  git 

    git remote add origin git@123.com
    git checkout master -f
    git pull
    git add .
    git commit -m 'update'
    git push



## 

### Error in exception handler

 laravel:
app/config/app.php 

    'debug' => flase, 'debug' => true,

,app/storage ,apachewww-data

    sudo chown -R www-data:www-data app/storage

    2. rvm

    3. .bashrc

    4.

    5. rvm

        mkdir myapp
        cd  myapp/
        rails new demo
        cd demo
        rails server

ubuntu  ruby on rails

Post.title: gedit
Post._content:
SublimeText  ubuntu  gedit 

 - 

        sudo apt-get install gedit-plugins

 -  Gmate

        sudo apt-add-repository ppa:ubuntu-on-rails/ppa
        sudo apt-get update
        sudo apt-get install gedit-gmate

 -  TextMate 

    Download the latest version [gedit-tm-autocomplete-1.0.5.tar.gz](http://code.google.com/p/gedit-tm-autocomplete/downloads/detail?name=gedit-tm-autocomplete-1.0.5.tar.gz) from the downloads page
    Extract the archive and run install.sh
    Restart Gedit
    Enable "TextMate Style Autocompletion" in Edit->Preferences->plugins
Post.raw:

date: 2013-04-15
layout:  post
title:  "gedit "

categories:

tags:

---

SublimeText  ubuntu  gedit 

 - 

        sudo apt-get install gedit-plugins

 -  Gmate

        sudo apt-add-repository ppa:ubuntu-on-rails/ppa
        sudo apt-get update
        sudo apt-get install gedit-gmate

 -  TextMate 

    Download the latest version [gedit-tm-autocomplete-1.0.5.tar.gz](http://code.google.com/p/gedit-tm-autocomplete/downloads/detail?name=gedit-tm-autocomplete-1.0.5.tar.gz) from the downloads page
    Extract the archive and run install.sh
    Restart Gedit
    Enable "TextMate Style Autocompletion" in Edit->Preferences->plugins

ext/mcrypt

```

phpizephpizephpphpizephpyum install php53-devel

```
[root@*_* 14:48 mcrypt]# whereis phpize    //phpize
phpize: /usr/bin/phpize /usr/share/man/man1/phpize.1.gz

Configuring for:

```

configurephp-config

/usr/bin/php-config

```
gccyum install gcc
```
configure: error: no acceptable C compiler found in $PATH
```

```
[root@*_* 15:06 mcrypt]# make && make install
```


```
Installing shared extensions:     /usr/lib64/php/modules/
```
/usr/lib64/php/modules/mrcypt.so

php.iniextension=mcrypt.so

```
[root@*_* 15:09 mcrypt]# cd /etc/php.d
```
mrcypt.iniextension=mcrypt.so

```
[root@*_* 15:17 php.d]# echo 'extension=mcrypt.so' > mcrypt.ini
```
